intro: Cyrtandra kamokuensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Cyrtandra kamokuensis is considered an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world.
